applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the operation and governance of an occupational pension scheme providing death benefits. It is not an insurance policy application document or process. 2) While the document discusses life cover, it is structured as an occupational pension scheme under the Pensions Act rather than a direct insurance policy. 3) The regulation specifically addresses disclosure obligations during the insurance policy application process and notifications that must be given to consumers applying for insurance. This document instead contains scheme rules for an employer-established pension arrangement. 4) The document's primary audience is trustees and employers rather than individual consumers making insurance applications. 5) The disclosure obligations outlined in Regulation 332 are specific to direct insurance relationships with consumers, while this document governs a trust-based pension arrangement where the trustee, not the individual member, holds the policy.
regulation_title: Information to be provided about disclosure obligations
regulation_text: 332. (1) Where a consumer is applying for an insurance policy, an insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary shall notify the consumer, on paper or on another durable medium, of the possible consequences for the consumer of failing to comply with the duty of d isclosure applicable to that consumer. (2) The notification referred to in paragraph (1) shall include the following consequences, as applicable: (a) that a policy may be cancelled; (b) that claims may not be paid; (c) that the consumer may encounter difficulty in trying to purchase insurance elsewhere; (d) in the case of property insurance, that the failure to have property insurance in place, including by way of cancellation, could lead to a breach of the terms and conditions attaching to any loan secured on that property.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
